paragraphs.text:
%md
###Overview
This notebook will walk you through converting a Wikipedia dump to Parquet files.

###Configure the parser
See this page to add the correct dependencies to Zeppelin:
[Wiki](https://github.com/nielsenbe/Spark-Wiki-Parser/wiki/Configure-Zeppelin)

For testing purposes it is recommended that you parse all elements.  The exception to this is the parseRefTags.  If reference templates are not a concern then go ahead and turn this one off as it does have an impact on performance.

msg.data:
Overview

This notebook will walk you through converting a Wikipedia dump to Parquet files.

Configure the parser

See this page to add the correct dependencies to Zeppelin:
Wiki

For testing purposes it is recommended that you parse all elements. The exception to this is the parseRefTags. If reference templates are not a concern then go ahead and turn this one off as it does have an impact on performance.

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Read the XML

This next section reads the XML dump and converts it to Scala case classes.  No parsing is done in this step.  If you are getting errors about com.databricks.spark.xml then you may not have added the dependency correctly.  
See the top of the page for details on configuring Zeppelin.

Manually defining the xml saves us from having to spend time inferring it.

msg.data:
Read the XML

This next section reads the XML dump and converts it to Scala case classes. No parsing is done in this step. If you are getting errors about com.databricks.spark.xml then you may not have added the dependency correctly.
See the top of the page for details on configuring Zeppelin.

Manually defining the xml saves us from having to spend time inferring it.

paragraphs.text:
import spark.implicits._
import org.apache.spark.sql.types._

/* Dump Schema */
val schema = new StructType()
    .add("id",LongType,true)
    .add("ns",LongType,true)
    .add("restrictions",StringType,true)
    .add("title",StringType,true)
    .add("redirect", new StructType()
        .add("_VALUE",StringType,true)
        .add("_title",StringType,true),
        true)
    .add("revision", new StructType()
        .add("comment",StringType,true)
        .add("format",StringType,true)
        .add("id",LongType,true)
        .add("minor",StringType,true)
        .add("model",StringType,true)
        .add("parentid",LongType,true)
        .add("sha1",StringType,true)
        .add("timestamp",StringType,true)
        .add("contributor", new StructType()
            .add("id",LongType,true)
            .add("ip",StringType,true)
            .add("username",StringType, true),
            true)
        .add("text", new StructType()
            .add("_VALUE",StringType,true)
            .add("_space",StringType,true),
            true), 
        true)

/* Read into dataset */
val ds = spark.read
    .format("com.databricks.spark.xml")
    .option("rowTag", "page")
    .schema(schema)
    .load(source)
    .as[InputPage]

%md
### Parse the wikitext and XML attributes

This section is where the parsing happens.  We use map Partitions for efficiency and serialization reasons.

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Check for Errors
Error messages are stored in the parserMessage field of the page object.

msg.data:
Check for Errors

Error messages are stored in the parserMessage field of the page object.

paragraphs.text:
// Check for pages that failed parsing
val errors = items.filter(_.parserMessage != "SUCCESS")
val errorCount = errors.count

println(s" $errorCount out of $pageCount failed")

errors.toDF.select("id", "title", "parserMessage").show

%md
###Export results to Parquet files
Convert the Scala case classes to Parquet files.  Parquet files are a preferred format in Spark because they are highly compressed and columnar.

Comment out any parts you do not care about to save on space.  If you intend to follow the rest of the notebooks then do leave all of the parts in.

The Wikipedia domain classes can just as easily be saved to text, JSON, Hive, or JDBC.

msg.data:
Export results to Parquet files

Convert the Scala case classes to Parquet files. Parquet files are a preferred format in Spark because they are highly compressed and columnar.

Comment out any parts you do not care about to save on space. If you intend to follow the rest of the notebooks then do leave all of the parts in.

The Wikipedia domain classes can just as easily be saved to text, JSON, Hive, or JDBC.

paragraphs.text:
/* Split the pages and redirects into two different files */
/* Write pages */
items.createOrReplaceTempView("pages")
val pages = spark.sql("""
SELECT
  id,
  title,
  redirect,
  nameSpace,
  pageType,
  lastRevisionId,
  lastRevisionDate
FROM
    pages
WHERE redirect = ''
AND   parserMessage = 'SUCCESS'
""")

pages
    .write
    .mode("Overwrite")
    .parquet(destDB + "wkp_paged.parquet")

/* Write redirects */
val redirects = spark.sql("""
SELECT
    art.id      AS targetPageId,
    rdr.id      AS redirectPageId,
    rdr.title   AS redirectTitle
FROM
    pages rdr
JOIN
    pages art
    ON  art.title = rdr.redirect
""")

redirects
    .write
    .mode("Overwrite")
    .parquet(destDB + "wkp_redirects.parquet")

/* Write page elements */
items.flatMap(_.headerSections).write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB +  "wkp_headers.parquet")
items.flatMap(_.links).write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB + "wkp_links.parquet")
items.flatMap(_.texts).write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB + "wkp_text.parquet")
items.flatMap(_.tags).write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB + "wkp_tags.parquet")
items.flatMap(_.tables).write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB + "wkp_tables.parquet")


/* Flatten templates */
items.flatMap(_.templates).createOrReplaceTempView("templates")
val flatTemplates = spark.sql("SELECT parentPageId, parentHeaderId, elementId, templateType, isInfoBox FROM templates")
val flatTemplateParameters = spark.sql("SELECT tmp.parentPageId, tmp.elementId, params._1 AS paramName, params._2 AS paramValue FROM templates TMP LATERAL VIEW explode(parameters) AS params")
flatTemplates.write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB + "wkp_templates.parquet")
flatTemplates.write.mode("Overwrite").parquet(destDB + "wkp_template_parameters.parquet")

// If you are going to immediatly analyze the data then it is best to clear the parser cache

items.unpersist
